text: comments Sofia Vergara had a pep in her step on a recent outing. And there's little to wonder why, as the Modern Family actress had a day off from filming her hit series and used the free time for lunch with friends on Monday in Los Angeles. For the occasion, she kept things casual but maintained her typical figure-flattering silhouette in a pair of skinny jeans that were ripped at the knee, and a black top with a chic blue jacket draped over her shoulders. Bombshell in blue! Sofia Vergara looked chic clad in a blue jacket on a lunch outing with friends on Monday in Los Angeles The 44-year-old completed the look with a pair of soaring black booties that featured spiked heels. Her accessories were equally striking, with chunky dangling bead earrings, a patent leather purse with a goldtone chainlink strap, and a gold bracelet with large charms. The Hot Pursuit actress was joined by Jonathan Tisch, co-owner of the New York Giants football team, and his wife, Liz, co-founder of fashion retailer Suite 1521, and their daughter. Catching up: The Modern Family actress was joined by New York Giants co-owner Jonathan Tisch, his wise wife Liz (far right), and their daughter at The Hotel Bel-Air Glamour girl: The knockout didn't spare the accessories with chunky dangling bead earrings, a patent leather purse with a goldtone chainlink strap, and a gold bracelet with large charms Of course, the red carpet fixture likely had plenty to say about fashion, but she could've shared with the Giants honcho her recent experience filming an episode of Modern Family with retired NFL star Peyton Manning, the younger brother of Giants quarterback Eli Manning. The episode aired Wednesday. 'Another fun lunch with the New Yorkers❤❤ @tizzielisch @mason.lanee come back soon!!!!' Sofia captioned a photo of the meal at The Hotel Bel-Air. Girl talk: Sofia enjoyed a laugh as they made their way for lunch Brilliant booties: Sofia had a pep in her step wearing black spiked booties Day off! Taking to Instagram, she shared how she's preparing for the revelry. 'Straight from Nola!!?? King Cake!!!
